title.narrative: MENA Regional: Strengthening Trade Unions to Promote Democratic Change in Algeria, Libya, Morocco and Tunisia

description.narrative: The Solidarity Center builds the capacity of trade unions to effectively organize and represent the interests of workers, especially marginalized workers such as women and youth, to improve social and economic opportunities and promote greater social cohesion.

The Solidarity Center conducts trainings in the region on fundamental trade union practices--including organizing, bargaining and negotiation skills—as well as on worker rights and international labor standards. In Algeria, the Solidarity Center works with activists to hone their skills in organizing informal workers, particularly women and young workers, to increase their economic opportunities and protect their rights. In Morocco, the Solidarity Center works with national and regional unions defending worker rights, especially within the hospitality and telecommunications sectors, which are increasingly important to the Moroccan economy. In Tunisia, the Solidarity Center conducts trainings on collective bargaining and negotiation skills for public-sector workers. Additional training programs in the region focus on conflict resolution and negotiation processes, gender-based violence in the workplace and protecting the rights of migrant and domestic workers.
